definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
greater than or equal to ≥/at least as great as
pinyin: xiang1 dang1 yu2 huo4 da4 yu2

sentences.english: Considerable attention is given to the action of centrifugal force in grinding wheels.
sentences.chinese: 磨床砂轮的离心力作用受到相当的关注。

sentences.english: Yes, testing is expensive, but production outages can be more so.
sentences.chinese: 是的，测试费用相当高昂，但生产损耗可能会更大。

sentences.english: Jack has rather jaundiced opinions about all these modern ideas.
sentences.chinese: 杰克对所有这些现代观念都抱有相当偏颇的看法。

sentences.english: Yet regulating haemostasis is a complex balancing act.
sentences.chinese: 然而控制止血法这一平衡过程相当复杂。

sentences.english: It's a pretty good work lamp.
The words of the equivalent of 19 AnLun times of enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 经论字数相当于十九部《菩提道次广论》。

sentences.english: Quite a number of imprecise words are used in our everyday speech.
sentences.chinese: 我们的日常用语中有相当一部分是不确定词。

sentences.english: It need quite a long time return to the former stability after rain, 5.
sentences.chinese: 降雨过后相当长时间，滑坡才能恢复到雨前的稳定性。

sentences.english: Joseph draws such that flowers and plants and landscape painting have the standard suitable.
sentences.chinese: 约瑟夫画得花卉与风景画具有相当水准。

sentences.english: But once you get there, you're very disappointed for several reasons.
sentences.chinese: 但是一到那，你就发现有很多原因让你觉得相当失望。

sentences.english: That is especially true for antiretroviral therapy.
sentences.chinese: 这些对于反转录酶疗法的确相当正确。

sentences.english: Diatoms are also quite numerous, with the estimated number of species exceeding one million.
sentences.chinese: 硅藻种类也相当多，估计超过1百万种。

sentences.english: In other words, exclusions are quite standard.
sentences.chinese: 在其他的话，排除是相当的标准。

sentences.english: Scientists have a negative attitude to the theory.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们对这个理论的态度是相当消极的。

sentences.english: Most animals walking on four legs have long muzzles.
sentences.chinese: 大多数用四肢走路的动物口鼻部分都相当长。

sentences.english: Eutrophication is becoming a serious problem in most of the mariculture areas in China.
sentences.chinese: 当前，中国的多数海水养殖区富营养化相当严重。

definition: very/completely/utterly/extremely/absolutely/hundred percent/to divide into ten equal parts
straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns
